intro: Chamaeranthemum beyrichii var. beyrichii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with upright stems and dense foliage. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ability to thrive in bright, indirect light and its long blooming period. Its botanical features make it both ornamental and relatively easy to care for in indoor environments.
